wikipedia_page.main: Alfred George Jones (c. February 1861 – c. November 1935) was an English footballer who played as a full back. He was born in Walsall and represented the England national football team three times.

response: * February – Alf Jones (d. 1935), England international in three matches (1882–1883).
*Alf Jones (footballer, born 1861) (1861–1935), Walsall and England footballer
*Alf Jones (Australian footballer) (1885–1929), Australian footballer for Melbourne
*Alf Jones (footballer, born 1937), English football full back for Leeds United and Lincoln City in the 1960s

Despite his cup heroics, Aldridge moved back to the newly merged Walsall Town Swifts during that summer. He played in 13 matches in the Midland Association for the Saddlers in 1888–1889 and earned his second, and final, England cap in a match against Ireland in the British Home Championship at Anfield. Aldridge was the second player to play for England while at Walsall, after Alf Jones who appeared for the national side while playing for Walsall Swifts in 1882.
